intro: Palura ciliata, commonly known as the silky palura, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and hairy, ovate leaves with ciliated margins. Its showy, pink to purple flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Palura ciliata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and riverbanks.
